DataElement.preferredName: Patient History First Asthma Eczema Hay Fever Or Dust Allergy Onset Age Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A grouping of patients/participants into age groups to determine the age onset of the diagnosis of asthma, eczema, hay fever, or allergy to dust or mold.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient History First Asthma Eczema Hay Fever Or Dust Allergy
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._an account of all medical events and problems a person has experienced._Preceding all others in time or space or degree._A chronic respiratory disease manifested as difficulty breathing due to the narrowing of bronchial passageways._A pruritic papulovesicular dermatitis occurring as a reaction to many endogenous and exogenous agents (Dorland, 27th ed)._Inflammation of the nasal mucous membranes caused by an IgE-mediated response to external allergens. The inflammation may also involve the mucous membranes of the sinuses, eyes, middle ear, and pharynx. Symptoms include sneezing, nasal congestion, rhinorrhea, and itching. It may lead to fatigue, drowsiness, and malaise thus causing impairment of the quality of life._Or; used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._A fine powdery material such as dry earth or pollen that can be blown about in the air._A local or general reaction of an organism following contact with a specific allergen to which it has been previously exposed and to which it has become sensitized.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.:an account of all medical events and problems a person has experienced.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.
A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.

Property.preferredName: First Asthma Eczema Allergic Rhinitis Or Dust Hypersensitivity
Property.preferredDefinition: Preceding all others in time or space or degree.:A chronic respiratory disease manifested as difficulty breathing due to the narrowing of bronchial passageways.:A pruritic papulovesicular dermatitis occurring as a reaction to many endogenous and exogenous agents (Dorland, 27th ed).:Inflammation of the nasal mucous membranes caused by an IgE-mediated response to external allergens. The inflammation may also involve the mucous membranes of the sinuses, eyes, middle ear, and pharynx. Symptoms include sneezing, nasal congestion, rhinorrhea, and itching. It may lead to fatigue, drowsiness, and malaise thus causing impairment of the quality of life.:Or; used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:A fine powdery material such as dry earth or pollen that can be blown about in the air.:A local or general reaction of an organism following contact with a specific allergen to which it has been previously exposed and to which it has become sensitized.

Concepts.definition: Preceding all others in time or space or degree.
A chronic respiratory disease manifested as difficulty breathing due to the narrowing of bronchial passageways.
A form of dermatitis characterized by red, itchy, scaly, or crusty patches that can be chronic or intermittent.

Inflammation of the nasal mucous membranes caused by an IgE-mediated response to external allergens. The inflammation may also involve the mucous membranes of the sinuses, eyes, middle ear, and pharynx. Symptoms include sneezing, nasal congestion, rhinorrhea, and itching. It may lead to fatigue, drowsiness, and malaise thus causing impairment of the quality of life.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
A fine powdery material such as dry earth or pollen that can be blown about in the air.
An immune response that occurs following exposure to an innocuous antigen, but that does not require the presence of preformed antibodies to the antigen.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.
